snippet.title: World Athletics Championships: Usain Bolt beaten in farewell race by arch rival Justin Gatlin
snippet.content:
Justin Gatlin proves too strong for Christian Coleman and Usain Bolt.
AFP
Share
US veteran Justin Gatlin was booed after he stunned Usain Bolt to win the 100m world title in London. Gatlin, who served a doping ban between 2006-10 and won silvers behind Bolt at the last two world championships, clocked 9.92 seconds, with teammate Christian Coleman winning silver in 9.94sec. Bolt suffered a dreadful start and could only claim bronze in 9.95sec. MORE TO COME Originally published as
